titles.title: Medicare Drug Uniform Coverage Act of 2000
To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to preserve and provide for uniform coverage of drugs and biologicals under part B of the Medicare Program.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Ways and Means
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and Environment.

bill.summary: 10/19/2000--Introduced. Medicare Drug Uniform Coverage Act of 2000 - Amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to include as covered services and supplies any drugs and biologicals which are not usually self-administered by intravenous infusion or subcutaneous injection by the patient (currently, drugs and biologicals which cannot, as determined in accordance with regulations, be self-administered).
